meanings.definition: To lower in social status or rank.
meanings.sent1: When the teacher praised her hard work, it declasses the lazy student.
meanings.sent2: The new policy declasses those who do not meet the standards.
meanings.sent3: The fancy hat declasses the formal outfit, making it look silly.
meanings.sent4: His rude behavior declasses him in the eyes of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The torn jeans declass the otherwise elegant ensemble.

meanings.definition: To cause to be considered of a lower class or rank.
meanings.sent1: Her expensive taste in clothes declasses her in the eyes of her frugal friends.
meanings.sent2: The scandal declasses the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to show off only declasses him further.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti declasses the historic building, diminishing its grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The outdated technology declasses the otherwise modern office space.
